results.title: Enter Exit Cave
results.brief_description: Shows the Exit Cave in South-West Tasmania and raises issues concerning the preservation of such sites as part of our heritage. Presents spectacular views of the cave system and its fragile environment. No credits available.

results.title: Enso: El Nino Southern Oscillation
results.brief_description: A very brief and effective diagrammatic explanation of ENSO, or the “El Nino” effect which periodically reverses the normal weather patterns of the Eastern Australian-Indonesian areas and South America. ENSO lasts about a year and weakens the usual easterly trade winds which bring warm air and rainfall so that the rain then falls mid-Pacific.

results.title: Enrolled nurse
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, Philip Aislewood and Basic Films
results.brief_description: A young girl and an older woman with a grown-up family describe the stages of their two-year practical training course, in which they qualified together as State Enrolled Nurses.

results.title: Enquiry: K K K = Enquiry: Ku Klux Klan
results.creator_credit: David Dimbleby, David Webster and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A report from the southern states of USA on the notorious Ku-Klux Klan society founded after the Civil War to maintain white protestant supremacy. Shows Tuscaloosa in Alabama, one of the main centres of activity, and interviews Robert Sheldon, Imperial Wizard of the Klan, and Charles Morgan, a Birmingham lawyer, who regards the organisation as a collection of murderers. Collie Leroy Wilkinson, acquitted of the murder of the Civil Rights worker Mrs Violet Liuzzo, is introduced at a meeting as a hero. Includes 1921 and 1925 archival footage.

results.title: Enough Rope: Can I Write the Ending?
results.creator_credit: Kerry Brewster, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Zapruder's Other Films
results.brief_description: What would you do if you thought you were about to die? This is an inspiring and moving story of three strong women, Annie Robinson, Nadeen Kovacic and Jasmyne Russell, each confronting life’s hardest journey, and how they’ve chosen to face their cancer and its ramifications. Presented by Andrew Denton, first broadcast on ABC Television on September 10, 2007.

results.title: Enough guts to say no
results.creator_credit: Virginia Westbury, Paul Griffiths, Paul Griffiths Presentations and National Heart Foundation of Australia
results.brief_description: Designed to show teenagers that their desire to smoke is a subtle manipulation of their desire to belong and be accepted. Non-smoking teenagers demonstrate that liking and being liked is not related to smoking and that potential friends may be turned off by it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Virginia Westbury, Paul Griffiths, Paul Griffiths Presentations and National Heart Foundation of Australia

results.title: Enoch Arden
results.brief_description: Adapted from Lord Tennyson’s poem, it tells the story of a man’s love for his wife, which is so strong, he sacrifices his happiness for her good. Cast includes Wilfred Lucas, Linda Arvidson.

results.title: Ennui = L'Ennui [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Cedric Kahn, Paolo Branco, Centre National de la Cinematographie, Canal+, Madragoa Filmes, Ima Films and Gemini Films
results.brief_description: Martin is a philosopher suffering from ennui - listless at work, disinterested in films or literature, disenchanted with life and estranged from his ex-wife. One night he meets an elderly painter, who dies shortly afterwards whilst making love to his teenage muse, Cecilia. Intrigued by Cecilia’s hold over the artist (who painted her obsessively) Martin starts to meet Cecilia every afternoon for uncommitted sex. At first Martin is aroused by Cecilia’s bland conversation and apparent feeble-mindedness but soon Cecilia’s detachment starts to obsess him and, unable to control his burgeoning neuroses, Martin’s life spins out of control. The enigmatic Cecilia, an inscrutable and monosyllabic presence to Martin’s excessive verbiage, exacerbates his feverous (and increasingly demonic) need to penetrate her calm. But Martin’s methods to destabilise Cecilia’s mystique are sexual violence and petty torments. Kahn’s roving camera, occasionally hand-held with sudden drops in lighting, suggests a documentary rather than a drama as he explores the futility of Martin’s masochistic irrationality. As a study of sexual obsession, “L’Ennui” pays detailed if detached attention to the sex act, deliberately failing to eroticise the couplings that at times appear utterly joyless to the protagonists. But at two hours and with a cyclical narrative, this film proves, at times, quite trying. Cast includes Charles Berling and Sophie Guillemin. In French with English subtitles.
